title: Flipped Learning English Education Design Utilizing Augmented Reality-Based Game Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Non-degree course designed to strengthen job-seeking individuals' workplace English proficiency, utilizing a blended learning environment with smartphone and AR-based content in a restricted technology setting

learning_goals: Learners can acquire and utilize 150+ job-related advanced English vocabulary items over four weeks via augmented reality board games.
Learners can generate context-specific English expressions by demonstrating creative problem-solving skills through flipped learning and ARGBL (Augmented Reality Game-Based Learning) activities.
Learners can self-diagnose communication skills through peer and self-evaluation in project-based activities.

resources: Board game kit with AR markers
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
